TEXT.English: [TAB]Minutemen were members of teams of select men from the American colonial militia during the American Revolutionary War. They vowed to be ready for battle against the British within one minute of receiving notice. These teams consisted about a fourth of the entire militia, and generally were the younger and more mobile, serving as part of a network for early response to any threat.[PARAGRAPH:1]The minutemen were 25 years old or younger, and were chosen for their enthusiasm, political reliability, and strength. They were the first armed militia to arrive at or await a battle. Officers, as in the rest of the militia, were elected by popular vote, and each unit drafted a formal written covenant to be signed upon enlistment. The militia typically assembled as an entire unit in each town between two and four times per year for training during peacetime, but as the inevitability of a war became apparent, the militia trained more often. The minute companies trained three to four times per week. It was common for officers to make decisions through consultation and consensus with their men as opposed to giving orders to be followed without question, sometimes even in the midst of battle.

[TAB]Although piracy had existed in the region throughout the decline of the Roman Empire, the barbarian invasions, the Muhammadan conquest and the Middle Ages, piracy became particularly flagrant in the 14th century when the native Berber dynasties were in decadence. The town of Bougie was then the most notorious pirate base. [PARAGRAPH:1]Several events influenced the growth of the pirates. The conquest of Granada by the Catholic sovereigns of Spain drove many Moors into exile. They revenged themselves by piratical attacks on the Spanish coast. They had the help of Muslim adventurers from the Levant, of whom the most successful were Hizir and Oruc, natives of Mitylene. Spain in self-defense began to conquer the coast towns of Oran, Algiers and Tunis. Oruç having fallen in battle with the Spaniards in 1518, his brother Hizir appealed to Selim, the sultan of Turkey, who sent his troops. He drove the Spaniards in 1529 from the rocky island in front of Algiers, where they had a fort, and was the founder of the Turkish power.

[TAB]The Cholas excelled in foreign trade and maritime activity, extending their influence overseas to China and Southeast Asia. A fragmentary Tamil inscription found in Sumatra cites the name of a merchant guild Nanadesa Tisaiyayirattu Ainnutruvar (literally, "the five hundred from the four countries and the thousand directions"), a famous merchant guild in the Chola country. The inscription is dated 1088, indicating that there was an active overseas trade during the Chola period.[PARAGRAPH:1]Towards the end of the 9th century, southern India had developed extensive maritime and commercial activity, especially with the Chinese and Arabs. The Cholas, being in possession of parts of both the west and the east coasts of peninsular India, were at the forefront of these ventures. The Tang dynasty of China, the Srivijaya empire in the Malayan archipelago under the Sailendras, and the Abbasid Kalifat at Baghdad were the main trading partners.[PARAGRAPH:1]The trade with the Chinese was a very lucrative enterprise, and Trade guilds needed the king's approval and the license from the customs force/department to embark on overseas voyages for trade. The normal trade voyage of those day involved three legs of journey, starting with the Indian goods (mainly spices, cotton and gems) being shipped to China and in the return leg the Chinese goods (silk, incense,iron) were brought back to Chola ports. After some materials were utilized for local consumption, the remaining cargo along with Indian cargo was shipped to the Arabs. Traditionally, this involved transfer of material/cargo to many ships before the ultimate destination was reached.

[TAB]The bulk of the fighting hosts were made of up general purpose levies and volunteers, but most Kongo polities maintained a small core of dedicated soldiers- nucleus of a standing army. Special detachments and commands called lucanzos were also used for various missions, and one such under a commander called Kakula ka Kabasa was defeated by the Portuguese in 1586 when crossing a river. Other special troops sometimes used included elite scouting units, the pombos, who sometimes ran with, and kept up with horses when they were used in the region. The pombos also performed pursuit duties. "Light" and "heavy" troop types were recognized. The light troops were far more numerous, and relied more on individual skill and technique (dodging spears for example). The "heavies" were more disciplined and relied on stronger defensive weapons and formations. A limited number such types operated in the Kongo kingdom, and were armed with shields, unlike other forces. They were reputedly the best soldiers in the country. Tactical units were recognized, from basic sections of 100-125 men, to larger units of 500, called mozengos or embalos. Groupings of these units made up a specific field force that could number up to 15,000 troops.

[TAB]Hacienda is a Spanish word for an estate. Some haciendas were plantations, mines or factories. Many haciendas combined these productive activities. The hacienda aimed for self-sufficiency in everything but luxuries meant for display, which were destined for the handful of people in the circle of the patrón, also known as the hacendado.[PARAGRAPH:1]Haciendas originated in land grants, mostly made to conquistadors. It is in Mexico that the hacienda system can be considered to have its origin in 1529, when the Spanish crown granted to Hernán Cortés the title of Marquess of the Valley of Oaxaca, which entailed a tract of land that included all of the present state of Morelos. Significantly, Cortés was also granted an encomienda, which included all the Native Americans then living on the land, and with power of life and death every person on his domains.

[TAB]An installation intended for the cooling, freezing, and cold storage of perishable food products and other perishables. It operates as an independent enterprise, comprises a cold-storage warehouse with truck and railroad platforms, compressor and condenser rooms for a refrigerating system, a cooling tower, reservoirs and a pumping station for a circulating water supply, administration and residential buildings, and other buildings and installations.[PARAGRAPH:1]Port cold-storage facilities are used for the short-term storage of freight when freight is transferred from one type of transport to another, for example, from water to railroad transport, and are usually built in river ports or seaports. Central cold-storage facilities are intended for the long-term storage of products drawn from processing-and-procurement cold-storage facilities for the purpose of creating reserves. Commercial cold-storage facilities, such as refrigerated cabinets and sectional coolers, are used for the short-term storage of products at trading depots and in, for example, stores, dining rooms, and restaurants. In addition to general-purpose cold-storage facilities, which are intended for the storage of a wide variety of products, specialized cold-storage facilities are built for the storage of such products as fruits, vegetables, eggs, and salted fish.

[TAB]Tambos (Quechua for "inn") were Incan structures built for administrative and military purposes. They were found alongside the Incan road network. They typically carried supplies, and served as lodging for itinerant state personnel (such as chasquis, Incan messengers, and quipucamayocs, those who could read and create quipus, for example) and as depositories of quipu-based records. Swift communication was achieved through the tambo network, and messages reached their destinations effectively and efficiently.[PARAGRAPH:1]Remains of tambos are scattered throughout modern-day Peru, Bolivia, Chile, and Colombia. Spanish conquistador and chronicler Pedro Cieza de León made numerous references to the tambos in his "Crónicas de Perú". In the following passage, Cieza de León described the general uses for the tambos that he learned from native peoples:[PARAGRAPH:1]And so there would be adequate supplies for their men, every four leagues there were lodgings and storehouses, and the representatives or stewards who lived in the capital of the provinces took great care to see that the natives kept these inns or lodgings (tambos) well supplied. And so certain of them would not give more than others, and all should make their contribution, they kept the accounts by a method of knots, which they call quipus, and in this way, after the troops had passed by, they could check and see that there had been no fraud.

[TAB]In March 1808 AD, the Portuguese royal family and ministers arrived in Rio de Janeiro to take refuge in Brazil as Napoleon's forces overran their homeland. The prince regent Joao, ruling in the stead of his mother Maria I, who was incapacitated due to mental illness, re-established his capital in Rio and ruled the empire from there. While in residence, he put in place all the ministries of a sovereign capital, as well as founding a royal library, a military academy, a royal mint, a printing office, and medical and law schools. In 1815, Joao declared Brazil a kingdom, co-equal with Portugal in the empire. Following the defeat of France, he preferred to remain in Brazil until called back to Portugal to deal with radical revolts. In April 1821, Joao appointed his son Pedro to the regency. Pedro's ministers, many Brazilian born, urged independence; the young regent issued a declaration of independence for Brazil in September 1822 and was crowned as Emperor Pedro I within three months. In 1825 the Portuguese government officially recognized Brazil's sovereignty, and within the year most of the European nations followed suit.[PARAGRAPH:1]General Ernesto Geisel assumed the presidency in 1974, and immediately launched into a "slow, gradual and safe" policy of returning rule to a democratic government. Over several years he ended the torture of political prisoners, censorship of the press, and finally the junta itself when he repealed the Fifth Institutional Act. His successor continued the process, and in 1985 the first free elections made Jose Sarney president. With a stable government and thriving economy, Brazil has since taken a leading role in regional affairs, being a founding member of organizations such as the Latin Union, Organization of American States, Mercosul, and Union of South American Nations. At the beginning of a new millennium, Brazil is poised to assume an equally influential role on the world stage.

[H1]Simon Bolivar[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]President of Gran Colombia[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] July 24, 1783 - December 17, 1830 AD[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Simon Bolivar was one of South America's greatest generals. His victories over the Spaniards won independence for Bolivia, Panama, Colombia, Ecuador, Peru, and Venezuela. He is called El Liberator (The Liberator) and the "George Washington of South America."[PARAGRAPH:1]Bolivar was born in July 24, 1783, at Caracas, Venezuela. His parents died when he was a child and he inherited a fortune. As a young man, he traveled in Europe.[PARAGRAPH:1]As he returned to Venezuela, Bolivar joined the group of patriots that seized Caracas in 1810 and proclaimed independence from Spain. He went to Great Britain in search of aid, but could get only a promise of British neutrality. When he returned to Venezuela, and took command of a patriot army, he recaptured Caracas in 1813 from the Spaniards.[PARAGRAPH:1]The Spaniards forced Bolivar to retreat from Venezuela to New Granada (now Colombia), also at war with Spain. He took command of a Colombian force and captured Bogota in 1814. The patriots, however, lacked men and supplies, and new defeats led Bolivar to flee to Jamaica. In Haiti he gathered a force that landed in Venezuela in 1816, and took Angostra (now Ciudad Bolivar). He also became dictator there.[PARAGRAPH:1]Bolivar marched into New Granada in 1819. He defeated the Spaniards in Boyar in 1819, liberating the territory of Colombia. He then returned to Angostura and led the congress that organized the original republic of Colombia (now Ecuador, Colombia, Panama, and Venezuela). Bolivar became its first president on December 17, 1819.[PARAGRAPH:1]Bolivar crushed the Spanish army at Carabobo in Venezuela on June 24, 1821. Next, he marched into Educador and added that territory to the new Colombian republic. After a meeting in 1822 with another great liberator, Bolivar became dictator of Peru. His army won a victory over the Spaniards at Auacucho in 1824, which needed Spanish power in South America. Upper Peru became a separate state, named Bolivia in Bolivar's honor, in 1825. The constitution, which he drew up for Bolivia, is one of his most important political pronouncements.

[H1]Harun al-Rashid[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Caliph of Baghdad[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] March 17, 763 - March 24, 809 AD[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Harun al-Rashid, "Harun the Orthodox", the fifth of the Abbasid caliphs of Bagdad, and the second son of the third caliph Mahdi. His full name was Harun ibn Muhammad ibn Abdallah ibn Muhammad ibn Ali ibn Abdallah ibn Abbas. He was born at Rai (Rhagae) on the 20th of March AD 763, according to some accounts, and according to others on the 15th of February AD 766. Harun al-Rashid was twenty-two years old when he ascended the throne. His father Mahdi just before his death conceived the idea of superseding his elder son Musa (afterwards known as Hadi, the fourth caliph) by Harun. But on Mahdi's death Harun gave way to his brother.[PARAGRAPH:1]Rashid owed his succession to the throne to the prudence and sagacity of Yahya bin Khalid the Barmecide, his secretary, whom on his accession he appointed his lieutenant and grand vizier. Under his guidance the empire flourished on the whole, in spite of several revolts in the provinces by members of the old Alid family. Successful wars were waged with the rulers of Byzantium and the Khazars. In 803, however, Harun became suspicious of the Barmecides, whom with only a single exception he caused to be executed. Henceforward the chief power was exercised by Fadl bin Rabi, who had been chamberlain not only under Harun himself but under his predecessors, Mansur, Madhi and Hadi. In the later years of Harun's reign troubles arose in the eastern parts of the empire. These troubles assumed proportions so serious that Harun himself decided to go to Khorasan. He died, however, at Tus in March 809.[PARAGRAPH:1]The reign of Harun was one of the most brilliant in the annals of the caliphate, in spite of losses in northwest Africa and Transoxiana. His fame spread to the West, and Charlemagne and he exchanged gifts and compliments as masters respectively of the West and the East. No caliph ever gathered around him so great a number of learned men, poets, jurists, grammarians, cadis and scribes, to say nothing of the wits and musicians who enjoyed his patronage. Harun himself was a scholar and poet, and was well versed in history, tradition and poetry. He possessed taste and discernment, and his dignified demeanor is extolled by the historians. In religion he was extremely strict; he prostrated himself a hundred times daily, and nine or ten times made the pilgrimage to Mecca. At the same time he cannot be regarded as a great administrator. He seems to have left everything to his viziers Yahya and Fadl, to the former of whom especially was due the prosperous condition of the empire. Harun is best known to Western readers as the hero of many of the stories in the Arabian Nights; and in Arabic literature he is the central figure of numberless anecdotes and humorous stories. Of his incognito walks through Bagdad, however, the authentic histories say nothing. His Arabic biographers are unanimous in describing him as noble and generous, but there is little doubt that he was in fact a man of little force of character, suspicious, untrustworthy and on occasions cruel.

[H1]Lorenzo di Piero de' Medici[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Ruler of Florence[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] January 1, 1449 - April 9, 1492 AD[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Lorenzo di Medici was destined to a brief but intense life that would go down in the history of Florence and Italy. He was one of the great leaders of the Italy of his time, which precisely in Florence witnessed on extraordinary flowering of intellectual activities. He was a politician, a man of power and culture.[PARAGRAPH:1]Lorenzo began his public life very early and he succeeded his father when he was not yet twenty-one. Immediatly he had to face difficult situations such as financial problems, conspiracies, relations with the Papacy, with Kings princes and milers of the countries. Nevertheless slowly the "balance of power" that Lorenzo maintained with Milan, Venice and Naples reinforced the florentine position, and wise economic measures improved the family finances. But Lorenzo's genius went further than this: he continued his family's traditional patronage of artists, opening his house and gardens to the younger ones. First Leonardo then Michelangelo and many others such as Botticelli, Filippino Lippi etc. turned to him for aid and protection.[PARAGRAPH:1]In 1485, Girolamo Savonarola, a Dominican from the convent of San Marco began to seduce the Florentines with his prophetic language. He spoke of the Apocalypse and of the dreadful God, first from the pulpit of San Marco and then from that of the cathedral. Although it had been Lorenzo who had brought the Dominican back from exile in Bologna, Savonarola's preaching soon took on a tone of implacable accusation against his benefactor.[PARAGRAPH:1]The friar accused Lorenzo publicy and univocably of ruining the state and squandering the wealth of the people deposited in the public coffers. Those who attempted to appease the spirit of the friar received the answer, "I do not care. But let (the Magnificent) know that I am a foreigner and he is a citizen and the first of the city: I am to stay and he is to go: I shall stay and not he." Many saw in these words a prophesy of Lorenzo's death, like the lightning-bolt that had struck Brunelleschi's dome a few months before his death. Accounts of this last meeting between Lorenzo the Magnificent and Savonarola, differ, but one may suppose, or hope, that in the end the friar remembered above all his duties as a priest. Lorenzo died peacefully in the night between April 8 and 9, 1492 in the Villa of Careggi. Florence was deeply shaken by his death which left an immense void in the world.[PARAGRAPH:1]Two years after Lorenzo's death his eldest son Piero, called the "unfortunate", was exiled from Florence for his political "incapacity" and only after 18 years the Medici family could return to its home-town.

[H1]Songtsen Gampo[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Dharmaraja of Tibet[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] 617 - 649 AD[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Songtsen Gampo was the first Dharmaraja of Tibet. He married a Nepalese and a Chinese princess and was famous for building the Jokhang Temple of Lhasa which still stands today.[PARAGRAPH:1]Songtsen Gampo was the forefather of Buddhism in Tibet. Two generations before King Trisong Detsen invited Shantarakshita and Padmasambhava to Tibet, King Songtsen Gampo cultivated the nation for its transformation, clearing pathways for the dharma to enter and ultimately permeate Tibetan culture. Without Songsten Gampo there would be no Tibetan alphabet, Lhasa would have no Jokang, and the supreme demoness of Central Tibet might still be roaming the earth unfettered.[PARAGRAPH:1]Songtsen Gampo reigned from 617 to 650. His Yarlung dynasty was based in Central Tibet during an imperialist period in Tibetan history. Bon was the dominant religion, and Buddhism was only seminally present. No Tibetan translations of the Buddhist scriptures existed, partially because there was no written form of Tibetan, so Songsten Gampo instructed his minister Thonmi Sambota to travel to India, study Sanskrit, and develop a Tibetan script. He then commissioned the translation of several thousand texts.[PARAGRAPH:1]His celebrated successes in battle expanded the Tibetan empire deep into Nepal and China, and it was during these battles that he gained an appreciation of the neighbouring cultures. As a reminder of the great empire that Songtsen Gampo ruled, a large pillar still stands before the Potala palace in Lhasa, erected during his reign, on which is inscribed the agreement between the Tibetan and Chinese rulers to respect each other's borders. He studied Chinese, became skilled in the art of leadership, and most importantly, he adopted sacred codes of conduct from Buddhist scripture. Under his rule, sacred practices began to replace the shamanistic practices of the Bonpos.[PARAGRAPH:1]Songtsen Gampo's two queens can be credited for a great part of his cultural awareness. Bhirkuti, from Kathmandu, brought the traditions of Himalayan Buddhism. Princess Wengchen, daughter of the Tang emperor, brought a treasure trove of ancient Chinese wisdom. She travelled across the steppes to her husband with a collection of Chinese classic literature and texts on sacred astrology, geomancy, and medicine.[PARAGRAPH:1]Many obstacles lay in Princess Wengchen's path as she headed to Yarlung. She had a vision of a gargantuan demoness who lay sprawled across the Himalayas, so large that one limb lay in Paro, Bhutan and another lay in Western Tibet. When she arrived in Yarlung, she shared her vision with her new husband. Recognizing the value of the treasures that his bride brought to him, as well as the importance of her vision, King Songsten Gampo commissioned thirteen demoness-subjugating temples across the land, built over the demoness's vital organs, ankles, wrists, and torso, forever binding her from wreaking havoc. The Lhasa Jokang was built over her heart centre, and Wengchin's Buddha statue was placed inside, where it still resides. Other such temples are Trenduk Lhakhang in Tsetang and Paro Kyichu in Bhutan.[PARAGRAPH:1]King Songtsen Gampo is considered a human emanation of Avalokiteshvara, and he was the grandfather of King Trisong Detsen. Songtsen Gampo meditated for several years in a cave that is now at the core of Potala palace, and is revered for his great patronage of Buddhism.[PARAGRAPH:1]Through his enlightened leadership, the path was cleared for the dharma to be propagated throughout the provinces, and for Buddhism to flourish.

[H1]Yaqub al-Mansur[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Caliph of Morocco and Al-Andalus[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] c. 1160 - January 23, 1199 AD[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Abu Yusuf Ya'qub al-Mansur, in full Abu Yusuf Ya'qub Ibn 'abd Al-mu'min Al-mansur (born c. 1160—died Jan. 23, 1199, Marrakech, Mor.), third ruler of the Mu'minid dynasty of Spain and North Africa, who during his reign (1184–99) brought the power of his dynasty to its zenith.[PARAGRAPH:1]When his father, Abu Ya'qub Yusuf, died on July 29, 1184, Abu Yusuf Ya'qub succeeded to the throne with minor difficulties. In November factious tribes in Algeria captured Algiers and other towns, but by 1188 he had pacified his African territories and returned to his Spanish possessions to check the encroachments of the Portuguese and Castilians. His efforts took seven years—until the Battle of Alarcos (July 18, 1195), when he decisively defeated the Castilian army of Alfonso VIII and took the title of al-Mansur (“the Victor”). The following year he advanced as far as Madrid but was unable to take it.[PARAGRAPH:1]Having defeated all of his enemies, al-Mansur returned to Marrakech, where he went into partial retirement and appointed his son Muhammad as his heir. Al-Mansur was a great builder of public works, many of which still stand.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Asvaka[COLOR_REVERT] is a barbarian unit roaming in Central Asia.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cidainh[COLOR_REVERT] is a barbarian unit roaming in Gaul.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Farari[COLOR_REVERT] is a barbarian unit roaming in the Niger delta.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Huluganni[COLOR_REVERT] is a barbarian roaming in Asia Minor.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Medjay[COLOR_REVERT] is a barbarian unit roaming in Nubia.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Mohawk[COLOR_REVERT] is a barbarian unit roaming in North America.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Mounted Brave[COLOR_REVERT] is a barbarian unit roaming in North America.
This Thai replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Knight[COLOR_REVERT] is very effective against other Mounted units and while attacking Riflemen.
This powerful mounted unit (the Phoenician replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]War Elephant[COLOR_REVERT]) has a bonus against melee units, alongside the bonus against other mounted units.

This powerful archery unit (the Babylonian replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Archer[COLOR_REVERT]) gets a first strike chance and gets defensive bonuses in cities and on hills. I has does additional collateral damage when attacking enemy units.
TEXT.French: Cette unité primitive équipée d'un arc (unité babylonienne qui remplace l'[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]archer[COLOR_REVERT]) obtient des bonus majeurs contre les unités de combat et lorsqu'ils défendent une ville.
TEXT.German: Diese frühe Fernkampfeinheit, die babylonische Variante des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bogenschützen[COLOR_REVERT], besitzt bedeutende Boni gegen Nahkampfeinheiten sowie für die Verteidigung von Städten.
TEXT.Italian: Questa antica unità di arcieri, l'equivalente babilonese dell'[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Arciere[COLOR_REVERT], ha un grande bonus contro unità da mischia e mentre difende una città.
TEXT.Spanish: Esta temprana unidad de tiro con arco, el sustituto babilonio del [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Arquero[COLOR_REVERT], recibe grandes bonificaciones contra unidades de cuerpo a cuerpo y mientras defiende una ciudad.

TEXT.English: This Italian replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Infantry[COLOR_REVERT] is the first modern era soldier. It's faster than all other non-mounted units.
TEXT.French: Cette unité est le premier soldat de l'ère moderne. A utiliser pour contrer des ennemis ayant de nombreuses unités équipées d'armes à feu.
TEXT.German: Diese Schießpulver-Einheit ist der erste Soldat der Moderne. Setzen Sie ihn gegen Gegner mit vielen Schießpulver-Einheiten ein.
TEXT.Italian: Questa unità è il primo soldato dell'era moderna. Usala per contrastare le unità con armi da fuoco.
TEXT.Spanish: Esta unidad es el primer soldado de la edad contemporánea. Sirve para contrarrestar a enemigos con muchas unidades con armas de pólvora.

TEXT.English: A [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bombard[COLOR_REVERT] can bombard enemy city fortifications and has a chance to withdraw from combat when losing. When attacking another unit, they cause collateral damage to other enemy units sharing the target's space.
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]bombardes[COLOR_REVERT] peuvent bombarder les fortifications des villes ennemies et ont la possibilité de rompre le combat. Lorsqu'elles attaquent une autre unité, elles peuvent provoquer des dommages collatéraux aux unités ennemies partageant la case de la cible.
TEXT.German: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bombarden[COLOR_REVERT] nehmen feindliche Festungen unter Beschuss und können sich aus aussichtslosen Schlachten zurückziehen. Beim Angriff eines Katapults werden alle Einheiten auf dem Geländefeld des Ziels beschädigt.
TEXT.Italian: Una [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]bombarda[COLOR_REVERT] può bombardare le fortificazioni delle città nemiche e ha l'abilità di ritirarsi dal combattimento quando sta perdendo. Quando attacca le altre unità, la catapulta può causare danno supplementare a tutte le unità poste sulla stessa casella del bersaglio.
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bombarda[COLOR_REVERT] puede cañonear fortificaciones de ciudades enemigas y tiene la posibilidad de retirarse cuando está perdiendo un combate. Cuando ataca, inflige daños colaterales a las demás unidades enemigas que compartan casilla con el objetivo.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cataphract[COLOR_REVERT], the Byzantine replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Knight[COLOR_REVERT], is earlier available than a Knight, and has a bonus against melee units.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]cataphractaire[COLOR_REVERT] (unité byzantine qui remplace le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]chevalier[COLOR_REVERT]) est plus puissant que ce dernier, mais est vulnérable aux premières attaques.
TEXT.German: Der [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Kataphrakt[COLOR_REVERT], die byzantinische Variante des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Ritters[COLOR_REVERT], besitzt einen höheren Stärkewert, ist jedoch nicht gegen Erstangriffe immun.
TEXT.Italian: La [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Catafratta[COLOR_REVERT], l'equivalente bizantino del [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cavaliere[COLOR_REVERT], è più forte ma non è immune agli attacchi improvvisi.
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Catafracto[COLOR_REVERT], el sustituto bizantino del [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Caballero[COLOR_REVERT], tiene más fuerza, pero carece de inmunidad a los ataques de iniciativa.

TEXT.English: This Moorish replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Privateer[COLOR_REVERT] is stronger on coastal tiles and provides some gold when sinking enemy ships.

This Tamil replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Caravel[COLOR_REVERT] is stronger and can transport all units. It's earlier available than a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Caravel[COLOR_REVERT], but it requires [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Astronomy[COLOR_REVERT] to be able to cross ocean tiles.

This powerful siege unit (the French replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cannon[COLOR_REVERT]) has a bonus against gunpowder and siege units. As well as the other bonus' of the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cannon[COLOR_REVERT].
This Mayan replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Archer[COLOR_REVERT] is provides extra food in the nearest city when winning a fight. So your cities will grow quicker.
TEXT.French: Cette unité de combat rapproché primitive (unité maya qui remplace les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]unités équipées de lances[COLOR_REVERT]) est insensible aux premières attaques et ne nécessite ni fer ni cuivre pour être construite.
TEXT.German: Diese frühe Nahkampfeinheit (die Maya-Variante des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Speerkämpfers[COLOR_REVERT]) ist gegen Erstangriffe immun. Ihre Ausbildung erfordert weder Eisen noch Kupfer.
TEXT.Italian: Questa antica unità da mischia (che per i Maya sostituisce il [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Lanciere[COLOR_REVERT]) è immune agli attacchi improvvisi e non richiede ferro o rame per essere costruita.
TEXT.Spanish: Esta temprana unidad de cuerpo a cuerpo (el sustituto maya del [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Lancero[COLOR_REVERT]) es inmune a los ataques de iniciativa y no es necesario tener hierro ni cobre para construirla.

TEXT.English: This powerful melee combat unit (the Greek replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Axeman[COLOR_REVERT]) recies extra strength when fighting mounted and melee units.
TEXT.French: Cette puissante unité de combat rapproché (l'unité grecque qui remplace les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]soldats avec hache[COLOR_REVERT]) est moins vulnérable aux chars que les soldats avec hache.
TEXT.German: Diese effektive Nahkampfeinheit (die griechische Variante des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Axtkämpfers[COLOR_REVERT]) ist im Kampf gegen Streitwagen nicht so unterlegen wie der Axtkämpfer.
TEXT.Italian: Questa potente unità da mischia (l'equivalente greco del [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Guerriero con ascia[COLOR_REVERT]) non è così vulnerabile ai carri da guerra.
TEXT.Spanish: Esta poderosa unidad de cuerpo a cuerpo (el equivalente griego al [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Soldado con hacha[COLOR_REVERT]) no es tan vulnerable a los Carros como lo son los Soldados con hacha.

TEXT.English: This melee unit (the Persian replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Spearman[COLOR_REVERT]) is more effective than the spearman against archery units.
TEXT.French: Cette puissante unité de combat rapproché (l'unité perse qui vient remplacer le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]lancier[COLOR_REVERT]) est plus efficace que le lancier contre les unités équipées d'un arc.
TEXT.German: Diese mächtige Nahkampfeinheit (die persische Version des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Speerkämpfer[COLOR_REVERT]) ist im Kampf gegen Bogenschützen effektiver als der normale Speerkämpfer.
TEXT.Italian: Questa potente unità da mischia (l'equivalente Persiano dello [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Lanciere[COLOR_REVERT]) è più effettiva delle Lancieri contro le unità d'attacco a distanza.
TEXT.Spanish: Esta poderosa unidad de cuerpo a cuerpo (que reemplaza al [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Lancero[COLOR_REVERT] en la civilización persa) resulta más eficaz que el Lancero contra unidades con proyectiles.

TEXT.English: This Mongol replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Knight[COLOR_REVERT] is faster than a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Knight[COLOR_REVERT] and does additional collateral damage.
TEXT.French: Cette unité montée (l'unité mongole qui vient remplacer l'[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]archer monté[COLOR_REVERT]) est extrêmement rapide car elle ignore les coûts de déplacement liés au terrain. Un excellent choix pour contrer des catapultes ennemies.
TEXT.German: Diese mächtige berittene Kampfeinheit (die mongolische Version des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Berittenen Bogenschützen[COLOR_REVERT]) ist extrem schnell und eignet sich hervorragend für Angriffe auf Katapulte.
TEXT.Italian: Questa potente unità montata (l'equivalente Mongolo dell'[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]arciere a cavallo[COLOR_REVERT]) è estremamente veloce, poiché ignora i costi di movimento del terreno. È ottima per contrastare le catapulte nemiche.
TEXT.Spanish: Esta poderosa unidad montada (que reemplaza al [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Arquero a caballo[COLOR_REVERT] en la civilización mongola) resulta muy rápida porque no le afectan los costes de movimiento del terreno. Es excelente para contrarrestar las catapultas enemigas.

TEXT.English: This Tibetan replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Horse Archer[COLOR_REVERT] receives a bonus when attacking cities. It is also very effective against [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]catapults[COLOR_REVERT].

Use this missionary to actively spread [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Zoroastrianism[COLOR_REVERT] in friendly cities (or rival cities with whom you have [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Open Borders[COLOR_REVERT]). This increases your income if you have the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Adur Farnbag[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Utilisez le missionnaire pour propager le [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Zoroastrianisme[COLOR_REVERT] dans les villes alliées (ou les villes rivales avec lesquelles vous avez un accord de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]libre passage[COLOR_REVERT]). Cela augmente vos revenus si vous avez construit le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Adur Farnbag[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Setzen Sie diesen Missionar ein, um in verbündeten oder feindlichen Städten (mit [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]offenen Grenzen[COLOR_REVERT]) das [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Zoroastrismus[COLOR_REVERT] zu verbreiten. Haben Sie die [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Adur Farnbag[COLOR_REVERT], erhöhen sich dadurch Ihre Einnahmen.
TEXT.Italian: Usa questo missionario per diffondere il [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Zoroastrismo[COLOR_REVERT] nelle città amiche (o nelle città rivali con le quali si ha [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]diritto di passaggio[COLOR_REVERT]). Aumentano le entrate se si possiede il [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Adur Farnbag[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: Este misionero sirve para propagar el [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Zoroastrismo[COLOR_REVERT] por ciudades amigas (o de civilizaciones rivales con las que se tenga una [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Apertura de fronteras[COLOR_REVERT]). Eso aumentará los ingresos si se tiene el [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Adur Farnbag[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Use [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Madeireiros[COLOR_REVERT] to improve the land around your cities and build roads that help establish trade routes. The Brazilian counterpart of the the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Worker[COLOR_REVERT] provides extra gold and production when it chops jungles and forests.
TEXT.French: Utilisez les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]ouvriers[COLOR_REVERT] pour aménager les alentours de vos villes et construire des routes qui permettent d'établir des itinéraires commerciaux.
TEXT.German: Setzen Sie [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bautrupps[COLOR_REVERT] ein, um das Umland Ihrer Städte zu verbessern und Straßen für die Erschließung von Handelswegen zu bauen.
TEXT.Italian: Usa i [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]lavoratori[COLOR_REVERT] per migliorare i terreni attorno alle città e per costruire strade, che contribuiscono agli scambi commerciali.
TEXT.Spanish: Los [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Trabajadores[COLOR_REVERT] mejoran la tierra que rodea las ciudades y construyen carreteras que ayudan a establecer rutas comerciales.

TEXT.English: This Indonesian replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Privateer[COLOR_REVERT] is earlier available so plundering the enemy treasure can start earlier.

The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Panzer[COLOR_REVERT] is the Prussian replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Tank[COLOR_REVERT] and gets a bonus when fighting foot soldiers. It also gathers experience much quicker than a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Tank[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]panzer[COLOR_REVERT] est l'unité allemande qui vient remplacer le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]blindé[COLOR_REVERT]. Il bénéficie d'un bonus contre les autres blindés.
TEXT.German: Der [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Deutsche Panzer[COLOR_REVERT] ist die deutsche Version des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Panzers[COLOR_REVERT] und hat einen Bonus im Kampf gegen andere Panzer.
TEXT.Italian: Il [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]panzer[COLOR_REVERT] è l'equivalente Tedesco dei [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]carri armati[COLOR_REVERT] e ottiene un bonus quando affronta altri carri armati.
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Panzer[COLOR_REVERT] reemplaza al [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Tanque[COLOR_REVERT] en la civilización alemana y obtiene una bonificación cuando combate contra otros tanques.

TEXT.English: Build this melee combat unit, the Congo replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Heavy Swordsman[COLOR_REVERT] to counter other melee units and early gunpowder units.
TEXT.French: Produisez cette unité de combat rapproché pour contrer d'autres unités du même type, car elle bénéficie alors d'un avantage sur ses adversaires.
TEXT.German: Diese Nahkampfeinheit ist vor allem im Kampf gegen andere Nahkampfeinheiten überaus effektiv.
TEXT.Italian: Realizza questa unità da combattimento corpo a corpo per contrastare le altre unità da mischia, poiché ottiene un aumento di forza contro di esse.
TEXT.Spanish: Esta unidad de cuerpo a cuerpo sirve para contrarrestar a otras unidades de ese mismo tipo, pues obtiene una mejora contra ellas.

TEXT.English: This Iranian replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Musketman[COLOR_REVERT] receives a bonus against other gunpowder units and starts with the Guerilla I promotion.
This powerful gunpowder combat unit (the English replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Rifleman[COLOR_REVERT]) gets a bonus against mounted units and does collateral damage when it attacks.
TEXT.French: Cette puissante unité équipée d'une arme à feu (l'unité anglaise qui vient remplacer le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]fusilier[COLOR_REVERT]) bénéficie d'un bonus contre les unités montées ou équipées d'armes à feu.
TEXT.German: Diese mächtige Schießpulver-Einheit (die englische Version des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Schützen[COLOR_REVERT]) hat im Kampf gegen berittene Einheiten und andere Schießpulver-Einheiten einen Bonus.
TEXT.Italian: Questa potente unità con armi da fuoco (l'equivalente Inglese del [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]fuciliere[COLOR_REVERT]) ottiene un bonus contro le unità montate e le altre unità con armi da fuoco.
TEXT.Spanish: Esta poderosa unidad con armas de pólvora (que reemplaza al [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Fusilero[COLOR_REVERT] en la civilización británica) obtiene una bonificación contra unidades montadas y otras unidades con armas de pólvora.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Siege Elephant[COLOR_REVERT] (the Mughal replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bombard[COLOR_REVERT]) is a strong siege weapon which gets a bonus when it attacks cities.

A [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Slave[COLOR_REVERT] can be used to create [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Slave Plantations[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT], which are stronger than normal [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Plantations[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]. It can also be used to boost the production of a city.
The Polish [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Winged Hussar[COLOR_REVERT] is very effective against [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Musketmen[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Riflemen[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Cette unité marque la transition entre la cavalerie de combat rapproché et celle équipée d'armes à feu. Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]cuirassier[COLOR_REVERT] est l'unité terrestre la plus puissante jusqu'à l'avènement de la [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]cavalerie[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Diese Einheit kennzeichnet den Wechsel von der Nahkampf- zur Schießpulver-Kavallerie. Der [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Kürassier[COLOR_REVERT] repräsentiert die stärkste Landeinheit bis zum Aufkommen der [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Kavallerie[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Italian: Quest'unità segna il passaggio della cavalleria da unità da mischia a unità con armi da fuoco. Il [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Corazziere[COLOR_REVERT] è la più forte unità terrestre fino all'arrivo della [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cavalleria[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: Esta unidad marca la transición de la caballería de cuerpo a cuerpo a la de armas de pólvora. El [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Coracero[COLOR_REVERT] es la unidad terrestre más fuerte hasta la entrada de la [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Caballería[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Art Studio[COLOR_REVERT] provides a big culture boost and allows a city to produce units and buildings faster, but also adds unhealthiness in cities. [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Forges[COLOR_REVERT] are required to build the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Colossus[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Eiffel Tower[COLOR_REVERT], and [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Statue of LIberty[COLOR_REVERT] world wonders, and the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ironworks[COLOR_REVERT] national wonder.

Build the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ball Court[COLOR_REVERT], the Mayan replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Amphitheatre[COLOR_REVERT], to provide cities with an extra happiness and it provides extra experience to melee and archery units.
TEXT.French: Construire le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]terrain de jeu de balle[COLOR_REVERT], bâtiment maya qui remplace le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Colisée[COLOR_REVERT], permet de conférer aux villes trois visages heureux au lieu d'un.
TEXT.German: Durch den Bau des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ballplatzes[COLOR_REVERT], die Maya-Variante des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Kolosseums[COLOR_REVERT], erhöht sich die Zufriedenheit einer Stadt auf 3 (statt 1).
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci il [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Campo da palla[COLOR_REVERT], che per i Maya sostituisce il [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Colosseo[COLOR_REVERT], per dare alle città tre risorse di felicità invece di una sola.
TEXT.Spanish: Construye el [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Campo del juego de pelota[COLOR_REVERT], el sustituto maya del [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Coliseo[COLOR_REVERT], para darles a las ciudades 3 de felicidad en vez de 1.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Caravanserai[COLOR_REVERT] (the Iranian replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Market[COLOR_REVERT]) increases a city's wealth as well as providing an extra trade route. They also increase the city's happiness with access to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Fur[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ivory[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Silk[COLOR_REVERT], or [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Whales[COLOR_REVERT].

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cold Storage Plant[COLOR_REVERT] (the Argentine replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Supermarket[COLOR_REVERT]) gives an extra gold bonus if the city has access to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Cows[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Pigs[COLOR_REVERT], or [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Sheep[COLOR_REVERT].

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Glassmaker[COLOR_REVERT] (the Phoenician replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Market[COLOR_REVERT]) increases a city's wealth as well as providing an extra trade route. They also increase the city's happiness with access to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Fur[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ivory[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Silk[COLOR_REVERT], or [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Whales[COLOR_REVERT].

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Gompa[COLOR_REVERT] (the Tibetan replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]University[COLOR_REVERT]) provides a free [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Priest[COLOR_REVERT] specialist and a defensive bonus. It's also available sooner than a regular [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]University[COLOR_REVERT].

The Tamil [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Sangam[COLOR_REVERT], which replaces the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Library[COLOR_REVERT], boosts your cities' research and provides culture. It has an extra cultural boost which the regular [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Library[COLOR_REVERT] doesn't have.

The Thai [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ho Trai[COLOR_REVERT], which replaces the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Library[COLOR_REVERT], boosts your cities' research and provides culture. It's cheaper and provides extra happiness.

[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Kaizen Plants[COLOR_REVERT], the Japanese replacements for [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Coal Plants[COLOR_REVERT], provide power for the Factory, although the pollution will hurt your city's health. It provides a free [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Engineer[COLOR_REVERT] specialist and a small production bonus.
TEXT.French: L'[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]usine de schistes[COLOR_REVERT], version japonaise de la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]centrale thermique[COLOR_REVERT], fournit de l'énergie aux usines, mais la pollution détériore la santé de vos citoyens.
TEXT.German: Die japanischen [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Schieferwerke[COLOR_REVERT] ersetzen die [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Kohlekraftwerke[COLOR_REVERT] und versorgen Fabriken mit Energie, allerdings wirkt sich die von ihnen verursachte Luftverschmutzung negativ auf die Gesundheit der Stadtbevölkerung aus.
TEXT.Italian: Le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]fabbriche di bitume[COLOR_REVERT], l'equivalente giapponese delle [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]centrali a carbone[COLOR_REVERT], forniscono energia alla fabbrica, anche su producono molto inquinamento e riducono la salute della città.
TEXT.Spanish: Las [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Plantas de esquisto[COLOR_REVERT], los equivalentes japoneses de las [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Centrales térmicas[COLOR_REVERT], alimentan las fábricas, aunque la contaminación perjudicará la salud de la ciudad.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Mbwadi[COLOR_REVERT] (the Congolese replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Market[COLOR_REVERT]) gives an extra gold bonus if the city has access to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Sheep[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Silk[COLOR_REVERT], or [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Cothon[COLOR_REVERT].

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Mbwadi[COLOR_REVERT] (the Congolese replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Market[COLOR_REVERT]) gives an extra gold bonus if the city has access to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Sheep[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Silk[COLOR_REVERT], or [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Cothon[COLOR_REVERT].

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Noria[COLOR_REVERT], the Moorish replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Aqueduct[COLOR_REVERT], provides a production bonus, in addition to the usual health bonus. A [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Baray[COLOR_REVERT] is needed to construct [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]The Hanging Gardens[COLOR_REVERT].

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Stele[COLOR_REVERT], the Ethiopian replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Monument[COLOR_REVERT], provides its city with a small amount of culture and also allows the city to have 2 priest specialist.
TEXT.French: La [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Stèle[COLOR_REVERT], monument éthiopien qui remplace le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Monument[COLOR_REVERT], fournit à la ville une petite quantité de culture et lui permet d'avoir 2 prêtres.
TEXT.German: Die [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Stele[COLOR_REVERT] ist die äthiopische Variante des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Monuments[COLOR_REVERT] und bewirkt einen leichten Anstieg des kulturellen Werts einer Stadt und ermöglicht die Existenz von 2 Priester-Spezialisten in der jeweiligen Stadt.
TEXT.Italian: La [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Stele[COLOR_REVERT], l'equivalente etiope del [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Monumento[COLOR_REVERT], fornisce alla città un piccolo contributo in cultura e permette alla città stessa di avere fino a due sacerdoti.
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Estela[COLOR_REVERT], el sustituto etíope del [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Monumento[COLOR_REVERT], proporciona a su ciudad una pequeña cantidad de cultura y también le permite tener 2 sacerdotes especialistas.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Egyptian Obelisk[COLOR_REVERT], the Egyptian replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Monument[COLOR_REVERT], provides a major bonus to Culture output in your city.
TEXT.French: L'[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]obélisque égyptien[COLOR_REVERT], c'est-à-dire le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Monument[COLOR_REVERT] égyptien, confère améliore nettement la production culturelle dans votre ville.
TEXT.German: Der [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ägyptische Obelisk[COLOR_REVERT], die ägyptische Variante des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Monuments[COLOR_REVERT],gewährt einen großen Kulturbonus.
TEXT.Italian: L'[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Obelisco egizio[COLOR_REVERT], l'equivalente egizio del[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]monumento[COLOR_REVERT], fornisce un grosso bonus alla cultura nella tua città.
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Obelisco egipcio[COLOR_REVERT], que reemplaza al [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Monumento[COLOR_REVERT], proporciona una importante bonificación al rendimiento cultural de vuestra ciudad.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Pagan Temples[COLOR_REVERT] provide a small amount of culture, and are a good way to expand city borders early on.
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]monuments[COLOR_REVERT] fournissent une petite quantité de culture, et sont utiles pour agrandir vos frontières culturelles au début du jeu.
TEXT.German: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Monumente[COLOR_REVERT] erhöhen den kulturellen Wert einer Stadt und ermöglichen die frühzeitige Ausdehnung der Stadtgrenzen.
TEXT.Italian: I [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]monumenti[COLOR_REVERT] forniscono una piccola quantità di cultura e servono a espandere velocemente i confini della città nelle fasi iniziali della partita.
TEXT.Spanish: Los [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Monumentos[COLOR_REVERT] proporcionan una pequeña cantidad de cultura y son una buena manera de ampliar las fronteras de una ciudad en los primeros tiempos.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Salon[COLOR_REVERT], the French replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Jail[COLOR_REVERT], increases a city's espionage output significantly. It also provides a cultural bonus, a happiness bonus if the city has access to colonial resources and increases the birthrate of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Great People[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]salon[COLOR_REVERT], version française de l'[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]observatoire[COLOR_REVERT], améliore la recherche scientifique d'une ville et augmente ses chances de générer un [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]artiste illustre[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Der französische [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Salon[COLOR_REVERT] ersetzt das [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Observatorium[COLOR_REVERT]. Er beschleunigt die wissenschaftliche Forschung einer Stadt und erhöht die Wahrscheinlichkeit für die Entstehung eines [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Großen Künstlers[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Italian: Il [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]salotto[COLOR_REVERT], l'equivalente francese dell'[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]osservatorio[COLOR_REVERT], incrementa la ricerca scientifica delle città nonché le probabilità che in città nasca un [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Grande Artista[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Salón[COLOR_REVERT], el equivalente francés del [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Observatorio[COLOR_REVERT], aumenta la investigación científica de la ciudad y las posibilidades de ésta de generar un [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Gran artista[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Sejmik[COLOR_REVERT], the Polish replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Courthouse[COLOR_REVERT], lowers the maintenance costs of a city, as well as providing a small gold and happiness bonus.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Seowon[COLOR_REVERT], the Korean replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]University[COLOR_REVERT], increases a city's research output, but is already available with [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Paper[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]sowon[COLOR_REVERT], version coréenne de l'[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]université[COLOR_REVERT], améliore la recherche davantage que les [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]universités[COLOR_REVERT] et produit de la culture.
TEXT.German: Das koreanische [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Seowon[COLOR_REVERT] ersetzt die [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Universität[COLOR_REVERT], beschleunigt aber in höherem Maße die Forschung und erhöht zudem den kulturellen Wert einer Stadt.
TEXT.Italian: Il [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]seowon[COLOR_REVERT], l'equivalente coreano dell'[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]università[COLOR_REVERT], velocizza la ricerca nelle città ancor più dell'[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]università[COLOR_REVERT] stessa e produce cultura.
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Seowon[COLOR_REVERT], el equivalente coreano de la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Universidad[COLOR_REVERT], aumenta la investigación en la ciudad aún más que la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Universidad[COLOR_REVERT] y proporciona cultura.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Stepwell[COLOR_REVERT], the Indian replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Aqueduct[COLOR_REVERT], is available with only [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Masonry[COLOR_REVERT], providing essential health early in the game.
The Chinese [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Taixue[COLOR_REVERT] provides more culture and allows more [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Scientists[COLOR_REVERT] than a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Library[COLOR_REVERT].
The Incan [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Tambo[COLOR_REVERT] provides more culture and is available earlier than a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Castle[COLOR_REVERT].

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ziggurat[COLOR_REVERT], the Babylonian replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Pagan Temple[COLOR_REVERT], provides more culture than a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Pagan Temple[COLOR_REVERT] and gives a small science boost.
TEXT.French: Construire la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ziggourat[COLOR_REVERT], bâtiment sumérien qui remplace le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]tribunal[COLOR_REVERT], nécessite moins de marteaux que ce dernier.
TEXT.German: Die [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Zikkurat[COLOR_REVERT] ist die sumerische Variante des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Gerichtsgebäudes[COLOR_REVERT], erfordert aber weniger Produktionseinheiten.
TEXT.Italian: Per costruire la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ziggurat[COLOR_REVERT], l'equivalente sumero del [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Palazzo di giustizia[COLOR_REVERT], ci vogliono meno scudi che per la controparte generica.
TEXT.Spanish: Construir el [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Zigurat[COLOR_REVERT], el sustituto sumerio de la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Delegación[COLOR_REVERT], requiere menos martillos que su equivalente genérico.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Temples[COLOR_REVERT] increase a city's happiness and culture. They are especially useful for expanding your civilization's borders during the early game.
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]petites synagogues[COLOR_REVERT] améliorent le bonheur et la culture des villes. Elles sont notamment utiles pour agrandir vos frontières culturelles au début du jeu.
TEXT.German: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Tempel[COLOR_REVERT] steigern die Zufriedenheit und Kultur einer Stadt. Sie eignen sich hervorragend, um Ihre Zivilisation bereits in der Frühphase des Spiels zu vergrößern.
TEXT.Italian: I [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]templi[COLOR_REVERT] aumentano la felicità e la cultura della città. Sono particolarmente indicati per espandere i confini della tua civiltà durante le fasi iniziali della partita.
TEXT.Spanish: Los [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Templos[COLOR_REVERT] aumentan la felicidad y cultura de la ciudad. Son especialmente útiles para expandir las fronteras de la civilización al principio de la partida.

TEXT.English: [TAB]In Civilization IV, a temple is defined as a building where the faithful come to worship. Christians call their temples "churches," while Muslims call theirs "mosques," and Jews call theirs, simply, "temples." Temples are far more common than cathedrals, but much less large and ornate. Even the smallest village can possess a temple.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Dans Civilization IV, un petit lieu de culte est défini comme un édifice dans lequel les fidèles viennent pratiquer leur religion : "églises" pour les chrétiens, "petites mosquées" pour les musulmans et "petites synagogues" pour les juifs. Ces petits lieux de culte sont bien plus courants que les grands lieux de culte mais sont de taille plus réduite et sont bien moins richement ornés. Même le village le plus petit peut posséder un petit lieu de culte.
TEXT.German: [TAB]In Civilization IV sind Tempel Gebäude, in denen Gläubige beten. Christen nennen ihre Tempel "Kirchen", Moslems "Moscheen". Es gibt deutlich mehr Tempel als Kathedralen. Allerdings sind sie wesentlich kleiner und schlichter. Selbst das kleinste Dorf kann einen Tempel besitzen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]In Civilization IV, il tempio è un edificio all'interno del quale i fedeli si recano a pregare. I Cristiani chiamano i loro templi "chiese", i Musulmani "moschee", gli Ebrei semplicemente "templi". I templi sono più comuni delle cattedrali, ma sono più piccoli e poco fastosi. Anche il villaggio più piccolo ospita un tempio.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]En Civilization IV, un templo se define como un lugar al que los fieles acuden a venerar. Los cristianos llaman a sus templos "iglesias", mientras que para los musulmanes son "mezquitas" y para los judíos, sencillamente, "templos". Son mucho más comunes que las catedrales, pero también mucho más pequeños y humildes. Hasta la más pequeña aldea puede poseer uno.

TEXT.English: [TAB]A monastery is a building where monks can retreat from the world and concentrate upon the divine. Usually a monastery will have strict rules of conduct to protect its unworldly members from temptation. In some monasteries, the monks are totally silent; in others no visitors are allowed inside. Monasteries usually have many daily rituals and religious services. [PARAGRAPH:1] Throughout the ages monasteries have often been centers of learning. In remote areas the monks may be the only literate people for miles around. Monks have often been employed as scribes, copying out the words of their religion's sacred scripture. Monasteries frequently have extensive libraries, holding religious, scientific, medical and philosophical texts.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Un monastère est un édifice dans lequel les moines peuvent se retirer du monde et se concentrer sur le divin. Généralement, les règles de conduite y sont strictes afin de protéger ses membres, détachés du monde, de la tentation. Dans certains monastères, les moines sont totalement silencieux ; dans d'autres, les visiteurs ne sont pas autorisés à pénétrer dans leur enceinte. Les monastères ont généralement de nombreux rituels et services religieux quotidiens. [PARAGRAPH:1]A travers les siècles, les monastères ont souvent été des centres d'érudition. Dans les zones retirées, les moines étaient parfois les seules personnes sachant lire et écrire à des kilomètres à la ronde. Ils ont souvent servi de scribes, recopiant les textes sacrés de leur religion. Les monastères ont généralement de grandes bibliothèques possédant des textes religieux, scientifiques, médicaux et philosophiques.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Klöster sind Gebäude, in die sich Mönche zurückziehen, um sich auf Gott zu konzentrieren. In Klöstern gelten strenge Verhaltensregeln, die die Mönche vor Versuchungen bewahren sollen. In einigen Klöstern herrscht ein strenges Redeverbot, in anderen sind keine Besucher gestattet. Die Mönche selbst gehen täglich ihren religiösen Pflichten nach. [PARAGRAPH:1] In der Vergangenheit waren Klöster stets auch Zentren des Wissens. In abgelegenen Gegenden waren die Mönche oft die einzigen gebildeten Menschen, die als Schreiber ihre religiösen Schriften kopierten. Klöster haben nicht selten Bibliotheken, in denen unzählige religiöse, wissenschaftliche, medizinische und philosophische Texte aufbewahrt werden.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il monastero è un edificio nel quale i monaci possono ritirarsi dal mondo e concentrarsi sul Divino. In genere, nel monastero vige un regolamento ferreo per proteggere i membri della comunità dalle tentazioni. In alcuni monasteri, i monaci erano completamente silenziosi e non erano permesse visite dall'esterno per non interrompere i rituali quotidiani e le cerimonie religiose. [PARAGRAPH:1] Nel corso dei secoli, i monasteri sono stati spesso centro di insegnamento: in alcune zone, i monaci erano sovente gli unici in grado di leggere e scrivere nel giro di diversi chilometri. Da sempre, i monaci sono stati utilizzati come scribi per copiare le parole sacre della propria religione; i monasteri ospitavano spesso delle biblioteche che contenevano testi religiosi, scientifici, medici e filosofici.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Un monasterio es un edificio en el que los monjes pueden retirarse del mundo para concentrarse en los asuntos de la divinidad. Normalmente tienen estrictas reglas de comportamiento para proteger a sus miembros de la tentación. En algunos monasterios, los monjes guardan un silencio total, mientras que en otros no se permite el acceso a los visitantes. Lo habitual es que sus miembros tengan que celebrar a diario muchos rituales y servicios religiosos. [PARAGRAPH:1] A lo largo de la historia, los monasterios han sido muchas veces centros de estudio. En las regiones remotas, los monjes podían ser las únicas personas letradas en muchos kilómetros a la redonda. A menudo han sido empleados como escribas, y se han dedicado a copiar los textos sagrados de su religión. Normalmente cuentan con grandes bibliotecas, que contienen textos religiosos, científicos, médicos y filosóficos.

TEXT.English: [TAB]In Civilization IV, a cathedral is defined as an especially large and ornate religious building where the faithful worship. Only the most prosperous cities can afford to create cathedrals, as they require huge amounts of raw material and years of dedicated labor by skilled craftsmen. For example, the Notre Dame Cathedral in Paris, France, took over two centuries to complete.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Dans Civilization IV, un grand lieu de culte est défini comme un édifice religieux particulièrement grand et richement orné dans lequel les fidèles pratiquent leur religion : "cathédrales" pour les chrétiens, "mosquées" pour les musulmans et "synagogues" pour les juifs. Seules les villes les plus prospères ont les moyens de construire de tels édifices. En effet, ils nécessitent d'énormes quantités de matériaux bruts et des artisans spécialisés doivent y consacrer des années de travail. Ainsi, il a fallu plus de deux siècles pour terminer la cathédrale Notre-Dame à Paris.
TEXT.German: [TAB]In Civilization IV sind Kathedralen große und prächtige Gotteshäuser, in denen Gläubige beten. Nur die reichsten aller Städte können sich den Bau einer Kathedrale leisten, da hierfür große Mengen an Baumaterial und die jahrelange Arbeit erfahrener Handwerker erforderlich sind. Die Kathedrale von Notre Dame in Paris wurde beispielsweise erst nach 200-jähriger Bauzeit fertig gestellt.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]In Civilization IV, viene definito cattedrale un edificio religioso particolarmente grande e sfarzoso adibito a luogo di culto per i fedeli. Solamente le città più prosperose possono permettersi l'edificazione di cattedrali poiché sono necessari un'enorme quantità di materiali e operai esperti. Per esempio, per completare la cattedrale di Notre-Dame de Paris, in Francia, ci sono voluti più di due secoli.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]En Civilization IV, una catedral se define como un edificio religioso especialmente grande y ornamentado en el que se reúnen los fieles para celebrar sus ritos. Solo las ciudades más grandes pueden permitirse el lujo de crear catedrales, puesto que requieren enormes cantidades de materias primas y años de dedicación por parte de trabajadores especializados. Por ejemplo, la catedral de Notre Dame, Francia, tardó dos siglos en completarse.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Monasteries[COLOR_REVERT] allow you to create [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Missionaries[COLOR_REVERT], who can spread the faith in other cities. They also provide culture and a slight boost to research.
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]monastères[COLOR_REVERT] permettent de former des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]missionnaires[COLOR_REVERT] qui peuvent propager la foi dans les autres villes. Ils améliorent aussi la culture d'une ville et accélèrent légèrement sa recherche.
TEXT.German: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Klöster[COLOR_REVERT] ermöglichen die Ausbildung von [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Missionaren[COLOR_REVERT]. Diese verkünden in anderen Städten Ihren Glauben, steigern den kulturellen Wert und beschleunigen die Forschung.
TEXT.Italian: I [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]monasteri[COLOR_REVERT] permettono la realizzazione dei [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]missionari[COLOR_REVERT], in grado di diffondere la fede in altre città. Inoltre, forniscono cultura e un piccolo aumento di ricerca.
TEXT.Spanish: Los [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Monasterios[COLOR_REVERT] permiten crear [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Misioneros[COLOR_REVERT], que pueden propagar la fe por otras ciudades. También proporcionan cultura y un cierto empuje a la investigación.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Zoroastrian Royal Fire[COLOR_REVERT] ([COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Zoroastrian Cathedral[COLOR_REVERT]) greatly increases a city's cultural output. It makes a city's citizens happy (if [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Zoroastrianism[COLOR_REVERT] is the state religion).

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Orthodox Cathedral[COLOR_REVERT] greatly increases a city's cultural output. It makes a city's citizens happy (if [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Orthodoxy[COLOR_REVERT] is the state religion).
TEXT.French: La [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Orthodox Cathedral[COLOR_REVERT] augmente nettement la production de culture d'une ville. Elle rend les citoyens de la ville heureux (si le [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Orthodoxy[COLOR_REVERT] est la religion d'état).
TEXT.German: Die [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Orthodox Cathedral[COLOR_REVERT] erhöht den kulturellen Ausstoß einer Stadt deutlich. Ist das [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Orthodoxy[COLOR_REVERT] in einer Stadt Staatsreligion, steigt die Zufriedenheit der Bevölkerung.
TEXT.Italian: La [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Orthodox Cathedral[COLOR_REVERT] aumenta notevolmente la produzione culturale della città. Inoltre, genera felicità tra i cittadini (se il [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Orthodoxy[COLOR_REVERT] è la religione di stato).
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Orthodox Cathedral[COLOR_REVERT] aumenta mucho la producción cultural de la ciudad. También hace felices a sus habitantes (si el [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Orthodoxy[COLOR_REVERT] es la religión oficial).
